Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Rewiever per le riviste seguenti: - BMJ - British Medical Journal; - BMC Health Services Research (section editor); - Bull WHO; - Cost-Effectiveness and Resource Allocation; - Health Economics; - Health Policy; - Health Policy and Planning; - Health Service Management Research: - Journal of International Development; - International Journal of Health Planning and Management; - JAMA - Journal of the American Medical Association; - International Journal of Integrated Care; - Malaria journal; - Pharmacoeconomics; - PLOS Medicine; - PLOS NTDs; - PLOS One; - Publius The Journal of Federalism; - Swiss Medical Weekly; - The Lancet Global Health; - Value in Health.
Section Editor: BMC Health Services Research

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Presentazioni e “organized session”: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene annual meeting 2012, Atlanta USA November 11–15, 2012
Presentazioni e “organized session”: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene annual meeting 2013 Washington, DC November 13–17, 2013
Membro Scientific Committee: Third Global Symposium on Health Systems Research – Science and Practice of People centred health systems, Cape Town, South Africa, 30 September -3 October 2014
Presentazioni e “organized session”: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene annual meeting 2014 New Orleans, LA USAm November 2–6, 2014
Membro Scientific Committee: 11th International Health Economics Association World Congress, De Gustibus Disputandum Non Est! Health Economics and Nutrition. Milan, Italy, 12-15 July 2015
Presentazioni e “organized session”: 11th International Health Economics Association World Congress, De Gustibus Disputandum Non Est! Health Economics and Nutrition Milan 12-15 July 2015
Membro Comitato Scientifico: Fourth Global Symposium on Health Systems Research - Resilient and responsive health systems for a changing world. Vancouver, Canada, 14-18 November 2016

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Analyzing the access to medicines and out of pocket payments for primary care in Tajikistan (2006-2007, Swiss Development Cooperation, part of the Tajik – Swiss Health Reform and Family Medicine Project). PI: F. Tediosi.

Modeling the epidemiology and the cost-effectiveness of different interventions to prevent and treat Malaria (PI: TA. Smith, Swiss Tropical and Public Heath Institute), Scientific responsible for the economic component: F. Tediosi: (2007-2009 the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation project #39777
Global action for Universal Health Coverage (2009-2010). Rockefeller Foundation, part of the Bocconi Initiative for Universal Health Coverage): US$ 250,700. PI: E. Missoni, F. Tediosi
Modeling the effectiveness of RTSS vaccine. (2011-2013, PATH Malaria Vaccine Initiative) US$ 389,877. PI: M. Penny, co-PI economic component: F. Tediosi
Costing methods for malaria service delivery (2012-2015.) Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation – Grant number OPP1053799. US$ 944,753. PI: F. Tediosi.

Economic evaluation of the Schistosomiasis Consortium for Operational Research and Evaluation (SCORE) projects. (2016-2018). Sub- award RR374 092/S001210 University of Georgia, US$ 288,861 (Grant number OPP50816 Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation). PI: F. Tediosi

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Member of the International Health Economics Association (http://healtheconomics.org). Member of the American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene (http://www.astmh.org/Home.htm). Member of Health Systems Global (http://www.healthsystemsglobal.org/). Member of the Italian Health Economics Association (AIES, Associazione Italiana di Economia Sanitaria – www.aiesweb.it

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Master in Business and Administration in International Health: Health Systems and Policy Module (40 hours). Academic years 2013-2016.

Summer School in Public Health Policy, Economics and Management in Lugano, Switzerland Anno 2014, 2015, 2016. Docente responsabile del corso: “Health financing policies, health system performance and obstacles to Universal Health Coverage”
PD (Venia docendi), Faculty of Science, University of Basel .

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Cost-effectiveness analysis of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria and anaemia control in infants (IPTi). IPTi Cost-Effectiveness Working Group (CEWG), part of the IPTi Consortium (http://www.ipti-malaria.org/ - 2006-2009, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation). PI: M. Tanner, G. Hutton. Country director: F. Tediosi

Including equity considerations in Health Technology Assessment (2008-2010, Italian Ministry of Health, Project: Back to Beveridge? The introduction of new technologies and its impact on equity of access to healthcare -the Beverdige Project). PI: C. Cislaghi. Scientific responsible for Università Bocconi: F. Tediosi.

Introducing education in global health in Italy. Fondazione Cariplo. Università Bocconi, Università degli Studi di Milano Bococca, Università del Piemonte Orientale. (2009-2012). Euro 1,415 546 (675,359 funded by F. Cariplo). Scientific responsible for Università Bocconi. E. Borgnovi, F. Tediosi, E. Missoni.

The Italian Long Term Care System. In collaboration with Institute for Studies and Economic Analyses (Istituto di Studi e Analisi Economica – ISAE) Project “Assessing Needs of Care in European Nations” (2009-2012, ANCIEN) FP7 Health-2007-3.2.2, Grant no. 223483. PI: S. Gabriele. Scientific responsible for Università Bocconi: F. Tediosi.

EuroHOPE – European Health Care Outcomes, Performance and Efficiency. identifying and assessing the relationship between outcomes and costs of care of specific but economically important diseases and health problems (2010-2014) (FP7 HEALTH-2009-3.2-2; FP7 reference number: 241721. Euro: 3,990,000. PI: Unto Häkkinen, National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland. Scientific Responsible for Università Bocconi: G. Fattore and F. Tediosi
